title: Thunderbird archive setting recommendations for Gmail accounts
content:
As per this support article (under "Archiving messages"), Thunderbird by default archives to Gmail's "All Mail" folder to match Gmail's behavior. This makes sense.

In the same article, it's recommended to unsubscribe from the "All Mail" folder for Gmail accounts. This also makes sense. However, after doing so, performing the Archive action on an email in Thunderbird causes it to resubscribe to All Mail.

More generally, unsubscribing from the target of "Other" in the "message archives" setting for the account will cause the setting to be unspecified (i.e. point to "Choose Folder"), after which the Archive action seems to use the last-specified target, re-subscribing to it if currently unsubscribed.

1. Is this the desired/expected behavior of the message archives settings? 2. For users who do wish to retain the habit of "Gmail archiving" (to keep the Inbox clean without managing specific labels/folders to move each message to), does the "unsubscribe from 'All Mail'" recommendation imply a recommendation to specify a new Thunderbird folder (= Gmail label) for this, e.g. the usual ' "Archives" Folder in:' option?
creator: goatfox

title: Comcast Automatic Account Configuration not working for me in release: 138.0 (64-bit)
content:
The Automatic Account Configuration in release 138.0 (64-bit) is not working for me on my WIN11 laptop. When I try to add my Comcast Email account to Thunderbird it finds the information for Comcast in the Thunderbird ISP Database. But when I continue by selection "done" the Credentials Window opens but fails to connect with this message:

Unable to connect

The connection was refused when attempting to contact localhost. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Thunderbird is permitted to access the web.

This process works perfectly on my 2 other PCs running Win10 with Thunderbird release 128.10.0ers I would really appreciate and ideas or steps to correct this issue. Thank you
creator: mrtibs

title: Filter's don't apply to Microsoft365 (via IMAP) account
content:
Hi all,

I have to use a Microsoft365 account for work, and I was lucky enough to obtain the possibility of connecting to it via imap.

Thunderbird filters work for all my other imap accounts, but not for the M365. I'm wondering if others are experiencing and and if there is a solution/workaround.

Thanks!
creator: francesco.ragazzi

title: POP3でログインできない
content:
こんにちは。 現在、以下の問題で困っております。

自身のパソコンではPOP3でメールにログインすることができません。 複数のアドレスを試しましたが、どれもログインできずにエラーメッセージが表示されます。 どのアドレスでも他のパソコンではポート番号や設定を変更せずに正常にログインできる状況です。

Thunderbirdを一度アンインストールし、再インストールを試みましたが、改善されませんでした。 また、メールアドレスとパスワードに誤りはないことを確認済みです。

IMAPではメールの受信は可能ですが、メッセージを送信することができない状態です。 大変お手数をおかけいたしますが、これらの問題の原因や解決方法についてご教示いただけますでしょうか。

どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。
creator: hiragori

title: password request/incorrect password
content: Thunderbird constantly asks me to enter my password, then informs me that the password is incorrect. I can't enter a new password or log in again with the old one. This happens after starting the program (with the same, correct password). For example, an hour after starting it, I want to send @ and then these messages appear. In the meantime, the mail works properly. This happens on different laptops but on the same email account. Does anyone know what's going on and what could be the reason?
